div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1189 Asia Minor, western, c. 1930 Burial: c. 450 B.C. (M) Contents: 11 AR Athens: 1 fr. Clazomenae?: 2 fr. Colophon: 5 fr. Magnesia?: 2 fr. Teos: 1 fr. Disposition: dispersed. A. E. Cahn Oct. 14, 1931, no. 709 The catalogue lists three electrum coins as belonging to the same hd., but as they are very early (late 7th cent. B.C.) they are probably intrusive
